sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ukraine says it's making advances in its counter-offensive against Russian forces, but Moscow rejects the claims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The UN Refugee Agency says the number of forcibly displaced people globally has reached a record high of over 108 million.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Ukraine says it's continuing to make advances and gain ground in its counter-offensive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Its forces claim to have captured more territory in the direction of Bakhmut, if only by some 250 meters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg in a meeting with President Biden agreed there had been progress, but added it was still early in Kyiv's renewed push against Russia's invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The support that we are providing together to Ukraine is now making a difference on the battlefield as we speak, because the offensive is launched and Ukrainians are making progress, making advances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's still early days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin has other ideas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In a meeting with Russian military bloggers, he said Russian forces were destroying Ukraine's armory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I said that there are more than 160 tanks, 360 BMPs, and not all of them are NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: There are also Soviet-made weapons, which are being destroyed. But they are burning well, as we expected. In Kiev, President Zelensky was meeting IAEA chief Rafael Grossier ahead of his visit to the Zaporizhzhya nuclear power plant to assess the impact of the breaching of the Kokovka Dam last week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, the death toll in Zelensky's hometown of Kruyere after an early morning strike on a building has risen to at least six people, with 25 more injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Donald Trump is whisked away by his security staff after his court indictment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The former U.S. president pleaded not guilty to historic criminal charges, alleging he retained classified documents after he left the White House.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Outside, his supporters were there in force, but not the thousands anticipated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Inside the court in Miami, Trump is said to have sat stony-faced after answering 37 felony counts. Earlier he'd been booked and a DNA sample given, but no mugshot was taken. Afterwards Trump called in at a Cuban restaurant where he gave his first reaction to the indictment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I think it's a rigged deal here. We have a rigged country, we have a country that's corrupt, we have a country that's got no borders, We have a country that's got nothing but problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Trump then traveled to his golf course in Bedminster to make an appearance before his followers and political donors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: He's the frontrunner for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Today we witness the most evil and heinous abuse of power in the history of our country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Very sad thing to watch. A corrupt sitting president had his top political opponent arrested on fake and fabricated charges of which he and numerous other presidents would be guilty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Right in the middle of a presidential election in which he is losing very badly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: In typical Trump style, the former president is determined to turn his judicial problems to his political advantage. It's for American voters to decide if he succeeds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: An army trainee in Japan has shot three fellow soldiers at an army firing range, killing

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: two of them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The 18-year-old suspect was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder at the Gifu prefecture in central Japan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Reports say he fired at other soldiers during a shooting exercise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Japan has a reputation for safety but has faced some high-profile violence in recent years. Prime Minister Fumio Kishida was almost hit by a pipe bomb at an election rally in April, and former Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was assassinated in July 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Mourners lighting candles and placing flowers at a service in the British city of Nottingham.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: lighting candles and placing flowers at a service in the British city of Nottingham.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Residents there are in shock after two 19-year-old students and a man in his 50s were stabbed to death and a van tried to mow down three other people. Police believe the incidents are linked and have arrested a 31-year-old man on suspicion of murder. While the motives remain unclear, the suspect in custody is believed to have a history of mental health issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Revered American novelist Cormac McCarthy has died at the age of 89.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Known for his bleakly violent apocalyptic visions of the American South, he was critically acclaimed by the likes of Stephen King and Oprah Winfrey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Widely seen as one of the US's greatest novelists, his most famous titles were The Road, All the Pretty Horses and No Country for Old Men, two of which were turned into well-received films.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: French police have been searching the Paris home of former president Nicolas Sarkozy. Prosecutors want him to face a new trial over alleged Libyan financing of his 2007 election campaign. Together with 12 others, Sarkozy is accused of seeking millions of euros in funding from the regime of the then Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi for his ultimately victorious presidency bid. Since leaving office, Sarkozy has been convicted twice, once for wiretapping. He's rejected any wrongdoing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The legal woes of British-American social media personality Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: have gone up a notch. Romanian authorities have amended the charge against them to human trafficking in continued form, a more serious offence than separate counts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The brothers are under house arrest pending a criminal investigation for suspected human trafficking, rape and forming a criminal gang.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They've denied the allegations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The case is expected to go to trial later this month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In Romania, trafficking of adults carries a prison sentence of up to 10 years. They've denied the allegations. The case is expected to go to trial later this month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In Romania, trafficking of adults carries a prison sentence of up to 10 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A solemn tribute from both allies and opponents, the Italian Senate has paid its respects to the late Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi with a moment of silence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: As divisive as he was, the media tycoon was Italy's longest serving premier and politicians came together to honour him. With mourning continuing inside his Milan residence, supporters have maintained a vigil outside, laying flowers and offering prayers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It was a spirit, a cry that showed in everything dove provava ad entrare, dalla televisione al calcio alla politica. Millions are expected to tune in for a live TV broadcast from within Italy and beyond.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The founder of Italy's Forza Italia party died on Monday aged 86.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A vast camp for internally displaced people in northeastern Syria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The United Nations Refugee Agency says the number of people displaced by war, persecution, violence and human rights abuses, has reached a record high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It's calling for concerted action, with its annual report noting that 19 million people were forced to flee their homes last year, an increase of 21 percent. As of the end of 2022, it says there was a total of over 108 million people forcibly displaced worldwide. This includes refugees, asylum seekers, internally displaced people and others in need of international protection.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The war in Ukraine was the top driver of displacement last year. The number of refugees from that country soared from some 27,000 at the end of 2021 to 5.7 million at the end of 2022, the fastest outflow of refugees anywhere since World War II.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The UNHCR says over half of those seeking safety come from just three countries, while 40 percent of all forcibly displaced people are children.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And the upward trend in global forced displacement shows no sign of slowing down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In Sudan, as of the end of May, over one million people had been newly displaced internally, and close to 400,000 had fled to neighboring countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: And it's middle and lower-income countries that are bearing the brunt, hosting 76 percent of the world's refugees and other people in need of international protection. The UNHCR is urging governments and NGOs to find new solutions to the growing problem and to ensure that those who have been forced to flee are not condemned to a permanent exile. The European Union has again extended a ban on Ukrainian grain imports

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: to five countries, including Poland. The move follows anger and protests from Polish farmers who were left with unsold grain or forced to sell it cheaply when faced with lower Ukrainian prices Today there is no permit, it is not legal. By 15 September at least, the crops will not be shipped to Poland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: There is a possible transit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Although the decision of the EU, supported by the government, brings a temporary relief, it was not met with much approval from Polish farmers, who fear in three months they'll face the same problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Today it is said that it will be completely closed, w tym roku, wciąż spotk po o wiele niższej cenie. Dzisiaj praktycznie nie wiemy, co uprawiać, żeby to było sprzedawalne.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Zachwiało to stabilnością, urwało kontakty nawet między młynami, mieszaniami, pasz.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ten łańcuch kontrolowany od pola do stołu się urwał.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: My nie powinniśmy konkurować z Ukrainą, tylko jedni i drudzy eksportować, but export and sell.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Experts insist it is worth taking care of Polish agriculture, which is not only ecological and meets EU standards, but also contributes to the increase of food security in Europe.

Z czego to wynika? Z tego, że Ukraina ma bardzo dobre warunki dla produkcji rolnej. Ma tańszą siłę roboczą.
